item.description:
It is Patriots bye week. What to do? How about a concert or two? At Harvard! (note I have set up an another Harvard concert for 4pm. That concert is free).  I will be there at 12:45 for the 1pm pre-concert lecture. However, you can skip the lecture if you wish. After the lecture, I'll look for people in the lobby. I suggest the far end of lobby, by the event day Box Office.

On the program are very different works....Barber's energetic School of Scandal, Brahms heroic gypsies(according to a local Brahms expert) 3rd Sym, and RVW's(my favorite composer) enigmatic 9th sym(finished when he was 85!).

 

Boston Conservatory Orchestra Sunday, November 4, 2012 - 2:00pm Sanders Theatre at Harvard University Buy tickets Price: $15(Note: $10 with a WGBH member card or student ID).

Bruce Hangen, conductor

BARBER: Overture to The School for Scandal
BRAHMS: Symphony No. 3
VAUGHAN WILLIAMS: Symphony No. 9

Pre-concert Lecture at 1 p.m.
Call the Harvard Box Office for tickets at (617) 492-2222.
item.how_to_find_us: I have a meetup button/will give out Cell Phone # the night before.
item.name: The Boston Conservatory Orchestra 2pm at Sanders Theatre, Memorial Hall, Harvard
